newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian air crash death toll raised to 17.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian air crash death toll raised to 17.

text.p: Indonesian authorities raised the death toll from a light plane crash in South Kalimantan province to 17, the official Antara news agency reported on Sunday.

The news agency had earlier said 15 people had died after the twin-engined Casa light aircraft plunged through the roof of a gas factory on Saturday about three km (two miles) from the airport at the provincial capital, Banjarmasin.
One of the plane's engines had caught fire shortly after take-off. The cause of the fire was still unknown.
Antara said 13 of the 15 passengers were killed immediately and a 12-year-old girl died on her way to hospital. The pilot and co-pilot were also killed and one factory worker died on the ground.
One surviving passenger and three other factory workers were in hospital in serious condition.

The plane had taken off from Banjarmasin's Syamsuddin Noor airport on Saturday at 3:23 p.m. local (1123 GMT), for Sampit in Central Kalimantan on Borneo island in overcast weather conditions and drizzle.
